49.user: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Pakistani dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Aloo Ki Tikki?

0.raw_text:
Aloo ki Tikki is a popular street food in India. It is a small ball made from mashed potatoes and various spices, then deep-fried. It is usually served with chutney and a spicy sauce, and sometimes with samosas or other street foods.

The ingredients needed for this recipe are: 1 cup of mashed potatoes, 1/2 cup of chopped onion, 1/2 cup of chopped green peas, 2 green chilies, 1 tsp of ginger paste, 1 tsp of cumin seeds, 1 tsp of coriander, 1 tsp of garam masala, 1 tsp of black pepper, 2 cups of flour, 2 cups of water, 1 tsp of salt, and 1 tsp of oil.

To prepare this dish, first, mash the potatoes with a fork. Then, add the chopped onion, green peas, green chilies, ginger paste, cumin seeds, coriander, garam masala, black pepper, and salt, and mix everything together. A dwarf planet is a celestial body that orbits the Sun and has enough mass for its own gravity to form it into a roughly spherical shape, but it has not cleared its orbital neighborhood of other objects. This definition was introduced in 2006 by the International Astronomical Union (IAU), primarily as a result of the discovery of the dwarf planet Eris, which was found to be similar in size to Pluto.

The IAU's definition of a dwarf planet is as follows: a celestial body that orbits the Sun and is in hydrostatic equilibrium (i.e. it has a roughly spherical shape due to its own gravity), but that has not cleared the neighborhood around its orbit. Therefore, it's the main difference between a dwarf planet and a planet, which is that a planet must clear its orbit.

Pluto, Ceres, Eris, and Haumea are the only dwarf planets that have been identified so far. However, the IAU estimates that there may be up to 200,000 dwarf planets in the asteroid belt and possibly even more in the Kuiper Belt.

Exfoliation is the process of removing the dead skin cells from the surface of the skin. There are two types of exfoliation - physical and chemical.

Physical exfoliation involves manually removing the dead skin cells by using products like scrubs, sponges, or brushes. Chemical exfoliation uses a chemical to remove dead skin cells. Some examples are AHAs, BHAs, and enzymes. 

Exfoliation helps to improve the texture of the skin, unclog pores, and improve the appearance of dark spots, blemishes, and other skin imperfections. It also helps to allow skincare products to penetrate the skin more effectively. 

But you have to be careful not to over-exfoliate. Over-exfoliation can lead to irritation, redness, and dryness, which can make your skin more vulnerable to infection and other skin conditions.
